nodes.bodyText:
I think echo is not required and the following is sufficient:
junitjar="${HADOOP_TOOLS_LIB_JARS_DIR}/junit-[0-9]*.jar"

testing:
bash-5.0$ arg1="foo bar"
bash-5.0$ echo "$arg1"
foo bar
bash-5.0$ arg2="${arg1}/junit-[0-9]*.jar"
bash-5.0$ echo "$arg2"
foo bar/junit-[0-9]*.jar

${junitjar} must be double-quoted.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -105,6 +105,8 @@ function mapredcmd_case
     minicluster)
       hadoop_add_classpath "${HADOOP_YARN_HOME}/${YARN_DIR}/timelineservice"'/*'
       hadoop_add_classpath "${HADOOP_YARN_HOME}/${YARN_DIR}/test"'/*'
+      junitjar=$(echo "${HADOOP_TOOLS_LIB_JARS_DIR}"/junit-[0-9]*.jar)

nodes.bodyText: Sorry, echo is required to resolve the jar file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -105,6 +105,8 @@ function mapredcmd_case
     minicluster)
       hadoop_add_classpath "${HADOOP_YARN_HOME}/${YARN_DIR}/timelineservice"'/*'
       hadoop_add_classpath "${HADOOP_YARN_HOME}/${YARN_DIR}/test"'/*'
+      junitjar=$(echo "${HADOOP_TOOLS_LIB_JARS_DIR}"/junit-[0-9]*.jar)

nodes.bodyText: We need shell filename expansion before adding the path to CLASSPATH. Java only accepts /path/to/* wildcard.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -105,6 +105,8 @@ function mapredcmd_case
     minicluster)
       hadoop_add_classpath "${HADOOP_YARN_HOME}/${YARN_DIR}/timelineservice"'/*'
       hadoop_add_classpath "${HADOOP_YARN_HOME}/${YARN_DIR}/test"'/*'
+      junitjar=$(echo "${HADOOP_TOOLS_LIB_JARS_DIR}"/junit-[0-9]*.jar)
